headline: Gilead Ordered to Pay Merck $200 Million in Patent Dispute
snippet: A federal jury on Thursday ordered Gilead Sciences to pay for infringing two Merck patents related to a lucrative cure for hepatitis C.

headline: Gilead Faces Fights Over Hepatitis C and H.I.V. Drugs
snippet: The company may face legal action in Massachusetts unless it drops prices for its hepatitis C drugs. In California, it is being sued over patents for an H.I.V. treatment.

headline: A Space Station, With Surveillance Cameras for Hire
snippet: Two cameras owned by the Canadian company UrtheCast are available for surveillance jobs from their low-earth orbit on the International Space Station.

headline: Drug Shortages Forcing Hard Decisions on Rationing Treatments
snippet: Such shortages are the new normal in American medicine. But the rationing that results has been largely hidden from patients and the public.

headline: Document Claims Drug Makers Deceived a Top Medical Journal
snippet: Filings in a case against Bayer and Johnson & Johnson over the blood-thinning drug Xarelto said the companies helped mislead editors at The New England Journal of Medicine.

headline: Top Lobbyist for Drug Makers Threads a Thicket of Outrage
snippet: Stephen Ubl, who became head of the Pharmaceutical Research and Manufacturers of America late last year, is facing rising criticism of the industry.

headline: The Faces of American Power, Nearly as White as the Oscar Nominees
snippet: An all-white group of Oscar-nominated actors set off protests, but the most powerful Americans in business, culture and politics are overwhelmingly white.

headline: Accuracy Concerns on Testing Device for Blood-Thinning Drug
snippet: Thousands of reports say a device to measure the levels of warfarin with a drop of blood is malfunctioning, yet it remains on the market.

headline: Johnson & Johnson Ordered to Pay $500 Million to Plaintiffs
snippet: Johnson & Johnson and its DePuy unit were ordered by a Texas federal jury on Thursday to pay five plaintiffs who said they were injured by Pinnacle metal-on-metal hip implants.

headline: Waste in Cancer Drugs Costs $3 Billion a Year, a Study Says
snippet: Many drug makers exclusively sell one-size-fits-all vials, meaning patients pay thousands for medicine they are never given, researchers say.

headline: Top Lobbyist for Drug Makers Threads a Thicket of Outrage
snippet: Stephen Ubl, who became head of the Pharmaceutical Research and Manufacturers of America late last year, is facing rising criticism of the industry.

headline: Chipotle Meeting Outlines Food Safety to Workers and Message for Public
snippet: Chipotle Mexican Grill told its nearly 60,000 employees what measures it was taking to improve food safety and to gain back trust after widespread reports of foodborne illnesses.

headline: To Fight Superbugs, Drug Makers Call for Incentives to Develop Antibiotics
snippet: In a declaration to be released at the World Economic Forum, more than 80 companies say government help and better reimbursement is needed to fight the problem of drug-resistant germs.
